name: 1,2-bis(4-aminophenyl)ethanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2983
Reason: 1,2-Bis(4-aminophenyl)ethanone has two phenyl groups, which would add approximately +40 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. Each amino group can also contribute approximately +10 due to the presence of hydrogen bonding. The presence of two carbonyl groups also raises the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, which can raise it by approximately +10°C each.
